name: tert-butyl acrylate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison can be ethylene, which has a melting point of -169.2 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the tert-butyl group (–CH2–CH2–CH2–) increases the molecular weight and size which generally raises the melting point. Additionally, the acrylate group (–CO–CH2–CH2–) introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20 to +30°C. The tert-butyl group also increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point.
